column2: User Query
column3: Chatbot Response

column2: My luggage didn’t arrive. What should I do?
column3: Please visit the Lost & Found counter near Belt 3 in the arrival hall. The staff will register a report and help trace your baggage through your airline’s tracking system.

column2: Where is the Lost and Found desk located?
column3: It’s located beside Belt 2 in the international arrivals area at Islamabad Airport, next to the Customs exit. Look for the blue “Lost & Found” signage.

column2: I lost my passport on the plane. Whom should I contact?
column3: Immediately visit your airline’s arrival counter or the Lost & Found office. Airport security will assist in coordinating with the airline to retrieve it.

column2: Is there a Lost and Found office at Islamabad Airport?
column3: Yes, it operates 24/7 beside the customs area in the arrivals terminal. The staff handles lost baggage, travel documents, and personal items.

column2: How can I report my missing bag?
column3: Go to the airline’s baggage claim counter or Lost & Found section, provide your baggage tag and flight number, and fill out a missing baggage form.

column2: My suitcase is damaged. Can I file a complaint?
column3: Yes, report damaged baggage at your airline’s claim counter before leaving the hall. Airlines usually inspect and log the damage immediately.

column2: I found someone’s bag. Where should I return it?
column3: Hand it over to airport security or directly to the Lost & Found counter. Please don’t open it — staff will record it and contact the rightful owner.

column2: How long does it take to recover lost luggage?
column3: It usually takes 24–48 hours, depending on airline tracing and connecting flights. The staff will contact you as soon as your baggage arrives.

column2: What are the Lost & Found office hours?
column3: The office is open round-the-clock to help passengers from both domestic and international flights. You can visit anytime after landing.

column2: Is there a helpline number for missing items?
column3: Yes, you can call +92-51-111-786-787 or email lostfound@islamabadairport.com for quick assistance. Keep your flight details ready.

column2: I lost my wallet near immigration. What should I do?
column3: Report it immediately to the airport security desk or Lost & Found office. They will check CCTV and coordinate with cleaning staff.

column2: Can I email about my missing luggage?
column3: Yes, email your flight number, description, and contact details to lostfound@islamabadairport.com. You’ll get a tracking reference within 24 hours.

column2: My bag didn’t arrive from Dubai. Who will help me?
column3: Report it at your airline’s arrival desk. They will coordinate with the Dubai ground staff and the Lost & Found team here to trace it.

column2: What documents do I need to claim my lost item?
column3: You’ll need your passport or CNIC and any proof of ownership like baggage tags or purchase receipts.

column2: I left my phone in the restroom. What should I do?
column3: Visit the Lost & Found counter and provide the restroom location and time. If found, staff will verify ownership and return it.

column2: Can someone else collect my lost item for me?
column3: Yes, another person can collect it with your written authorization and a copy of both IDs.

column2: Is there CCTV coverage in the baggage area?
column3: Yes, all belts and surrounding areas are under 24/7 CCTV surveillance. Footage can be reviewed by authorized staff upon request.

column2: How long are lost items kept at the airport?
column3: Unclaimed items are stored safely for 90 days in the Lost & Found storage area, after which they are handed to authorities.

column2: I found a passport at the waiting area. What do I do?
column3: Please hand it to the immigration counter or Lost & Found staff. They handle sensitive documents with priority.

column2: My baggage tag is missing. Can my bag still be traced?
column3: Yes, if you provide flight details, name, and bag description, staff can track it through the airline database.

column2: Is there a separate Lost & Found for domestic flights?
column3: Yes, domestic arrivals have a separate desk near Belt 1 for passengers of PIA, Airblue, and Serene Air.

column2: I lost my gold jewelry. Is there a way to recover it?
column3: Report it immediately to Lost & Found. Valuable items like jewelry are logged, sealed, and stored under supervision.

column2: Can I check online if my item has been found?
column3: Currently, online lookup isn’t active, but the helpline can confirm by checking the item list manually.

column2: What happens if nobody claims a lost item?
column3: It’s stored for 90 days and then transferred to airport authorities for disposal or donation.

column2: My child’s stroller didn’t come with our luggage.
column3: Report it at the baggage desk; strollers sometimes come on later flights or through special handling.

column2: Who manages Lost & Found at Islamabad Airport?
column3: The Airport Facilitation Department (AFD) manages the Lost & Found service under airport operations.

column2: Can I get compensation for my lost baggage?
column3: Compensation policies vary by airline. File a Property Irregularity Report (PIR) to initiate a claim.

column2: How do I identify my bag if it’s found?
column3: Describe color, size, brand, and any labels or stickers. Staff match it with stored items before release.

column2: Is there any fee for claiming a lost item?
column3: No, Lost & Found services are free for all passengers at Islamabad International Airport.

column2: Can I get help if I lost something in the taxi area?
column3: Yes, report it to the airport police post at the arrival exit, or visit Lost & Found for coordination.

column2: I lost my smartwatch during arrival. Can it be tracked?
column3: Smart devices are logged with serial numbers. If found, staff can identify it and contact you.

column2: I found a mobile phone near baggage claim. What should I do?
column3: Submit it at the Lost & Found desk. Staff record its IMEI and store it securely.

column2: My baggage arrived late. Will it be delivered to my home?
column3: Many airlines offer home delivery for delayed bags within Islamabad and Rawalpindi. Confirm at your airline desk.

column2: I forgot my laptop on the plane.
column3: Contact your airline immediately; the crew or ground staff will retrieve it if found.

column2: Is the Lost and Found office inside or outside arrivals?
column3: It’s located inside the arrivals hall, next to the customs clearance area.

column2: Can I call to check the status of my report?
column3: Yes, call the helpline with your case number. Staff will update you on progress.

column2: I lost a gold ring yesterday. Is it possible it’s found?
column3: If found, it will be in secure storage. Bring your ID to check with the Lost & Found supervisor.

column2: My luggage lock is broken. Whom should I report to?
column3: Inform your airline’s baggage claim counter; they handle damage reports on arrival.

column2: Can I claim another person’s item with permission?
column3: Yes, with an authorization letter, ID copies, and item details.

column2: What if my bag looks similar to someone else’s?
column3: Confirm the baggage tag before leaving. Staff can assist with verification.

column2: I forgot my jacket on the conveyor belt.
column3: Go to Lost & Found with your flight number and time; such items are usually logged quickly.

column2: Are lost items checked daily?
column3: Yes, all found items are cataloged and verified every 12 hours by the Lost & Found team.

column2: I left a file in the waiting area. Can I get it back?
column3: Visit the Lost & Found office; files and documents are kept in the secure section.

column2: Is there a WhatsApp number for Lost & Found?
column3: Not yet, but the team can be reached by phone or email anytime.

column2: Can I send someone to pick my lost bag tomorrow?
column3: Yes, with an authorization letter and CNIC copy of both individuals.

column2: I left my book on a trolley.
column3: Check at Lost & Found; small items are collected from trolleys daily.

column2: Can I track my complaint online?
column3: Tracking is currently manual; call with your case reference for updates.

column2: How soon should I report missing baggage?
column3: Immediately after noticing the loss. Quick reporting increases recovery chances.

column2: What if my bag was mistakenly taken by someone else?
column3: Lost & Found reviews CCTV footage and contacts passengers through airline data.

column2: I lost my identity card at the airport.
column3: Report it at the Lost & Found and local police helpdesk for documentation.

column2: My bag arrived torn and missing items.
column3: Please report it immediately to your airline’s claim counter. They’ll inspect the damage and initiate a compensation or replacement procedure.

column2: I lost my CNIC while exiting the terminal.
column3: Visit the Lost & Found desk and report it. They maintain a list of found documents and coordinate with airport security.

column2: How can I know if my bag was sent on another flight?
column3: The airline can trace it through the baggage tag number. Lost & Found will update you once it arrives.

column2: I lost my suitcase lock keys. Can airport staff help?
column3: For security reasons, staff can’t break locks, but airline maintenance can assist with verification and unlocking if needed.

column2: My luggage came wet or soaked. What can I do?
column3: Report it to your airline within the arrival area. They’ll note the condition and offer assistance for damaged contents.

column2: Can I claim insurance for lost baggage?
column3: Yes, if you purchased travel insurance, file your claim using the Lost & Found report and airline documentation.

column2: I lost my baggage receipt tag. How can I identify my luggage?
column3: Describe the bag’s color, brand, and any marks. Staff can verify ownership through your flight details.

column2: My luggage came late but without a tag. What to do?
column3: Report it to the Lost & Found section. They’ll check the tagless baggage list and confirm via airline data.

column2: Can I report lost luggage after leaving the airport?
column3: Yes, you can email or call the Lost & Found office within 24 hours with your flight and contact information.

column2: How do I know if someone submitted my lost item?
column3: The Lost & Found staff match reports daily and will contact you through the number provided in your complaint.

column2: What if my bag was mistakenly checked to another destination?
column3: The airline will reroute it to Islamabad. You’ll be contacted once it arrives.

column2: Can I get a written confirmation for my lost item report?
column3: Yes, you’ll receive a printed acknowledgment with your case reference number for future tracking.

column2: My luggage was delayed by a day. Will I be informed?
column3: Once your baggage arrives, Lost & Found will notify you through SMS or phone call.

column2: I forgot a baby bag on the seat in arrivals.
column3: Visit Lost & Found immediately. Such items are logged quickly and stored separately for easy retrieval.

column2: My luggage handle broke during transit.
column3: Report it to your airline before leaving. Airlines often provide repair or reimbursement options.

column2: Can Lost & Found share CCTV footage with me?
column3: CCTV footage can be viewed only by authorized personnel upon written request or police involvement.

column2: I found someone’s passport. Can I hand it to the airline?
column3: You may, but the recommended step is to submit it to the Lost & Found or immigration desk for secure handling.

column2: I lost my glasses near the exit area.
column3: Check with the Lost & Found desk; small personal items like glasses are usually turned in by cleaning staff.

column2: What if my baggage was sent to another city?
column3: The airline and Lost & Found team will coordinate to forward it to Islamabad and notify you.

column2: How can I prove an item belongs to me?
column3: Provide detailed description, photos if available, and ID verification.

column2: My bag is found but zipper broken. Will it be replaced?
column3: Airlines usually repair or compensate for minor damage if reported before leaving arrivals.

column2: How do I follow up on my lost luggage report?
column3: Call the Lost & Found helpline and mention your case number for updates.

column2: Can I register multiple lost items together?
column3: Yes, list all items in one report and describe each clearly.

column2: What if my missing bag arrived damaged?
column3: File a joint “damage and delay” report at the airline counter.

column2: I forgot my shopping bag in the waiting lounge.
column3: Lost & Found staff collect unattended items from the lounge every 2 hours.

column2: How long will Lost & Found store my item?
column3: Lost items are securely stored for up to 90 days before being handed over to authorities.

column2: My earphones are missing from my bag.
column3: Report theft suspicion immediately; security will assist with investigation.

column2: I left my car keys in the baggage trolley.
column3: Go to the Lost & Found counter; trolley cleaning staff regularly turn in found keys.

column2: Can I collect my lost item after a few days?
column3: Yes, bring your ID and report number; the office will release it after verification.

column2: I lost my boarding pass after landing.
column3: Visit the airline counter; they can reissue or confirm your travel details.

column2: My baggage is missing from Belt 4.
column3: Wait till the belt stops, then report to your airline’s counter or Lost & Found with your baggage tag.

column2: I lost my bag two days ago. Can I still get it back?
column3: Yes, if found, it’ll be in Lost & Found storage. Bring ID for collection.

column2: Who can I contact for lost duty-free items?
column3: Duty-free staff maintain a separate record; Lost & Found can assist in coordination.

column2: Can I report lost luggage through WhatsApp?
column3: Not at this time. Please use the helpline or email system.

column2: I found a jewelry box in arrivals.
column3: Kindly submit it at Lost & Found. Valuable items are kept under sealed storage.

column2: My luggage arrived with a broken wheel.
column3: Report it immediately; airlines may offer compensation or repair vouchers.

column2: How do I know if my complaint is registered?
column3: The staff will issue you a complaint number printed on the acknowledgment slip.

column2: I forgot a toy bag near Belt 1.
column3: Inform Lost & Found; such items are logged under the “family belongings” category.

column2: How can I contact my airline’s baggage desk?
column3: The Lost & Found office has airline contact extensions for direct assistance.

column2: I lost my bag’s handle cover.
column3: It’s considered a personal item; check Lost & Found’s small items log.

column2: My item was found but someone else claimed it.
column3: Ownership disputes are resolved through ID and proof verification.

column2: Is there a separate section for electronic items?
column3: Yes, phones, tablets, and laptops are stored in the “High-Value Items” area.

column2: Can I send my driver to collect my bag?
column3: Yes, with a signed authorization and both CNIC copies.

column2: I lost my credit card in the terminal.
column3: Immediately block it and report at Lost & Found for recovery.

column2: My suitcase looks tampered with.
column3: Do not open it in public; inform airline staff for inspection and report.

column2: Is there any penalty for lost trolleys?
column3: Trolleys are managed by the airport; lost tokens may have a small replacement fee.

column2: My bag came with another passenger’s tag.
column3: Inform Lost & Found immediately to correct the record and avoid confusion.

column2: Can I collect my item outside working hours?
column3: The Lost & Found operates 24/7, so you can collect it anytime.

column2: Is there a waiting time to file a report?
column3: Usually 5–10 minutes depending on passenger volume.

column2: I lost a charger in the arrival lounge.
column3: Report it; small electronics are tagged and stored for up to 30 days.

column2: Can I get CCTV proof for my missing bag?
column3: Only law enforcement or authorized staff can access footage upon your request.

column2: I forgot my handbag at the prayer area.
column3: Please visit the Lost & Found counter near Belt 3. Prayer area items are regularly collected and logged by cleaning staff.

column2: Can I collect my lost luggage after 10 PM?
column3: Yes, the Lost & Found office operates 24 hours a day. You can collect your luggage anytime with proper ID.

column2: I lost my smartwatch charger on the plane.
column3: Inform your airline desk immediately; crew may recover it during post-flight cleaning.

column2: What if my baggage was swapped with another passenger’s?
column3: Report it to the Lost & Found team. They will trace the other passenger through the airline system and assist in the exchange.

column2: My item is valuable. How can I ensure it’s safely stored?
column3: High-value items like jewelry and electronics are sealed and stored in a separate secure cabinet under camera supervision.

column2: I forgot my neck pillow near immigration.
column3: Check at the Lost & Found; small comfort items are often found and logged by airport housekeeping.

column2: Can I get a copy of the complaint I filed?
column3: Yes, a printed or emailed copy can be provided on request with your case reference.

column2: I found a boarding pass on the floor. What should I do?
column3: Submit it to the Lost & Found desk; unclaimed documents are stored for 30 days.

column2: My luggage zipper is broken and items are missing.
column3: Report both damage and missing item to your airline counter immediately for compensation claim.

column2: Can I track my missing luggage through my airline app?
column3: Some airlines provide real-time baggage tracking; confirm at your airline counter for details.

column2: I lost my bag 3 days ago and haven’t heard back.
column3: Follow up by calling the Lost & Found helpline with your case number for an update.

column2: How will I know if my bag is found?
column3: You’ll receive a call or email once your bag arrives. Always ensure your contact info is accurate on the report.

column2: I found a baby bottle near baggage area.
column3: Kindly hand it to Lost & Found staff; such items are kept in a separate hygiene-safe section.

column2: My perfume bottles leaked inside my bag.
column3: Report it to your airline’s desk. Liquids are subject to transport conditions and may not be compensated.

column2: Can I use the Lost & Found service if I’m not a passenger?
column3: Only passengers or their authorized representatives with valid documents can access it.

column2: My luggage came with tape marks as if opened.
column3: Report it before leaving the terminal; security will verify handling history.

column2: I forgot my medical bag on Belt 2.
column3: Go to Lost & Found immediately; essential medication is prioritized for return.

column2: Can I call to ask about found items before visiting?
column3: Yes, call +92-51-111-786-787 and mention the date, flight, and item details for confirmation.

column2: What if I lost my luggage tag and forgot the flight number?
column3: The staff can trace it through your passport, airline, and approximate time of arrival.

column2: I left my wristwatch in the washroom.
column3: Lost & Found regularly collects such items from restrooms. Please provide the location and time.

column2: I left my food container at the baggage area.
column3: Perishable items are not stored, but you can confirm with Lost & Found if it was handed in.

column2: My baby stroller was damaged.
column3: Inform your airline’s arrival counter immediately; airlines handle stroller compensation separately.

column2: Can I contact Lost & Found on social media?
column3: Currently, only phone and email contact is supported for security reasons.

column2: I forgot my jacket in the arrival bus.
column3: Report it to the Lost & Found desk; shuttle service items are logged by bus attendants.

column2: Can I get a copy of CCTV recording for my missing bag?
column3: Only law enforcement can access CCTV footage upon a written complaint.

column2: I lost my charger cable in the seating area.
column3: Go to Lost & Found; charging cables are among the most commonly found items.

column2: My luggage color is similar to others. How to avoid confusion next time?
column3: Attach bright ribbons or tags before check-in to identify your bag easily.

column2: I lost my prayer mat in the terminal.
column3: Visit Lost & Found; items from prayer areas are collected daily.

column2: Can Lost & Found send my item through courier?
column3: Currently, only in-person collection or authorized representative pickup is allowed.

column2: My wallet was returned but money missing.
column3: Report immediately to airport security for investigation.

column2: Can I retrieve my lost SIM card from Lost & Found?
column3: Yes, if turned in, but ownership verification is required through CNIC or SIM registration.

column2: My small handbag is missing. What should I do first?
column3: Stay calm and visit Lost & Found before leaving the terminal. Provide color, brand, and contents for quick matching.

column2: I found a USB drive in the lounge.
column3: Submit it to Lost & Found. Found electronics are sealed for privacy protection.

column2: How long does it take for found items to be listed?
column3: Usually within 12 hours after collection and logging by staff.

column2: I lost my umbrella near the arrival exit.
column3: Check Lost & Found; umbrellas are placed in the “General Items” section.

column2: Can I authorize my friend to check for my item?
column3: Yes, but only with a signed authorization letter and valid IDs.

column2: My luggage was delayed and arrived next day. Do I still report it?
column3: Yes, to ensure it’s properly logged and confirmed as delivered.

column2: I lost my student ID card.
column3: Check at Lost & Found; such cards are stored for 30 days before being sent to issuing institutions.

column2: What should I do if I find someone’s watch?
column3: Hand it to Lost & Found staff; they’ll record its brand, color, and location found.

column2: I lost my medical prescription file.
column3: Such documents are handled carefully and stored in the document section of Lost & Found.

column2: My luggage had fragile stickers but is broken.
column3: Report it to the airline; fragile items are covered under their handling policy.

column2: Can I get an update via SMS for my case?
column3: Yes, if you provided your phone number in the complaint form.

column2: I left my face mask box on a trolley.
column3: It may not be stored, but confirm at Lost & Found if found by staff.

column2: My bag’s combination lock is jammed.
column3: Airline staff can assist in unlocking after ownership verification.

column2: Can I access the Lost & Found storage area myself?
column3: No, only authorized staff have access for security and privacy reasons.

column2: I lost my shopping bag from Duty Free.
column3: Report at Lost & Found; they coordinate directly with Duty Free management.

column2: What happens to unclaimed cash found at the airport?
column3: It’s deposited with airport authorities after verification and record entry.

column2: I forgot my travel pillow on the luggage trolley.
column3: Visit Lost & Found; such comfort items are commonly turned in.

column2: I lost my ring near the arrival escalator.
column3: Inform Lost & Found; cleaning teams often recover jewelry during shift checks.

column2: I lost my wedding ring. Is there a special procedure for valuable jewelry?
column3: Yes, please report it immediately. All high-value items like jewelry are documented, sealed, and stored in a secure safe under supervision.

column2: My pet carrier is missing. What should I do if I can't find my pet?
column3: Report this urgently to the airline staff and Lost & Found. There is a special protocol for live animals, and they will initiate an immediate search.

column2: What happens if two people claim the same item?
column3: In such a dispute, both parties will be asked to provide definitive proof of ownership. The item will be held until ownership is clearly established.

column2: I left my art portfolio on the plane. Are fragile items handled differently?
column3: Yes, items marked as fragile are handled with extra care. Report it to your airline and Lost & Found, specifying the delicate nature of the contents.

column2: Can the Lost & Found office ship my found item to an international address?
column3: Some airlines offer this service for a fee, but the airport's Lost & Found office does not. You would need to arrange a courier pickup via an authorized person.

column2: I found a wallet containing a large amount of cash. What's the procedure?
column3: Please do not open it. Hand it over directly to a security officer or the Lost & Found counter. They will count and log the cash in a secure, transparent process.

column2: I suspect an airport staff member stole my missing item. Whom do I report this to?
column3: You should file a report with the Airport Security Force (ASF) or the police post at the airport, in addition to reporting it to Lost & Found.

column2: My bag has a tracking device (like an AirTag) and I can see its location. Can I go there myself?
column3: For your safety, do not go to the location yourself. Share the tracking information with airport security and the Lost & Found team, and they will retrieve it.

column2: I lost my university degree certificate at the airport. Is that kept securely?
column3: Yes, important documents like certificates are stored securely. Report it immediately with details, as these are held for a limited time before being handed to authorities.

column2: What happens if my found bag contains perishable food items?
column3: Perishable items are stored for a very short period (usually 24 hours). If unclaimed, they are disposed of for health and safety reasons.

column2: Can I get an official report from Lost & Found for my travel insurance claim?
column3: Yes, once you file a report, you can request a copy of the Property Irregularity Report (PIR) or an official acknowledgment letter for your insurance purposes.

column2: I lost the keys to my rental car. Where should I check?
column3: Check at the Lost & Found desk. Car keys are a commonly found item. You should also inform your car rental company immediately.

column2: I found a drone in the arrivals hall. What is the protocol for such items?
column3: Do not attempt to operate it. Please hand it over to the Lost & Found. Drones are registered as high-value electronics and stored securely after inspection.

column2: My bag was found, but it's water-damaged. Is the airport liable?
column3: The airport is generally not liable for damage caused by contents leaking or external conditions. However, report it to the airline, as their policy might offer compensation.

column2: What is the procedure for items left behind at the customs inspection desk?
column3: Items found at customs are handed over to the Lost & Found. You can report and claim them through the standard procedure.

column2: I lost my hearing aids. Are medical devices given priority?
column3: Yes, essential medical devices are treated with high priority. Please mention the urgency of the item when you file your report.

column2: Can I describe my lost item over the phone for verification instead of visiting?
column3: A detailed description over the phone can help locate the item, but for collection, you or your authorized representative must visit in person for verification.

column2: I found an official government document. Where should I take it?
column3: Please hand it directly to the immigration desk or the airport police. These are sensitive items that require special handling.

column2: How does the Lost & Found team verify ownership if I have no receipt for an item?
column3: They will ask for a very detailed description, including any unique marks, scratches, the contents (if it's a bag), or even photos of you with the item if available.

column2: I lost a gift that was still in its wrapping paper. How can I identify it?
column3: Describe the wrapping paper, the store it was from (if known), the shape, and the approximate weight. Do not unwrap found gifts to maintain their integrity.

column2: Is there a Lost & Found for items left in the airport parking lot?
column3: Yes, items found in the parking area are also submitted to the main Lost & Found office. You should also check with the parking management office.

column2: My child's school bag is missing. What's the process?
column3: Report it with details of the bag's color, cartoon characters, and any books or items inside. School bags are often found and can be retrieved from Lost & Found.

column2: I lost an item at my departing airport, not here. Can you still help?
column3: We can only assist with items lost at Islamabad Airport. You must contact the Lost & Found department of the airport where you lost the item.

column2: If I find my bag through the airline, do I still need to close my report with Lost & Found?
column3: Yes, please inform the Lost & Found office that your item has been recovered so they can close your case in their system.

column2: What happens to unclaimed books and documents?
column3: Books are held for 90 days and then donated. Official documents may be sent to the issuing authority or relevant embassy after a certain period.

column2: I lost my prayer beads (Tasbih). Where are such items usually kept?
column3: Small personal items like prayer beads are often found. Check with the Lost & Found counter. Items left in the prayer area are regularly collected and logged.

column2: My bag arrived but someone else's identical bag is gone. What should I do?
column3: This is a common mix-up. Report it to the airline immediately. They will contact the other passenger through their flight details to arrange a swap.

column2: Can I report a lost item on behalf of my elderly parent who isn't feeling well?
column3: Yes, you can file the initial report. However, for collection, your parent will either need to come in person or provide you with a signed authorization letter and their ID copy.

column2: I lost a musical instrument (a violin). Is there a climate-controlled storage for such items?
column3: While there is no special climate-controlled storage, such items are kept indoors in the main storage area, protected from extreme temperatures.

column2: Are there translators available at the Lost & Found desk if I don't speak English or Urdu?
column3: The staff primarily speaks English and Urdu. For other languages, they will try to assist, but it's helpful to have a translation app or a companion who can translate.

column2: What is the procedure if I find something that looks suspicious or dangerous?
column3: Do not touch it. Maintain a safe distance and immediately report it to the nearest security officer or airport staff.

column2: I left my hiking gear and walking stick behind. How are oversized items handled?
column3: Oversized items are stored in a separate, designated area. Report them with a detailed description; they are easily traceable if turned in.

column2: If my item is found, can I arrange for my hotel's concierge to pick it up?
column3: Yes, but you must provide the concierge with a signed authorization letter, a copy of your ID, and the claim reference number.

column2: What is the most common item that gets lost at the airport?
column3: The most commonly lost items are mobile phones, chargers, wallets, passports, and neck pillows.

column2: I lost a USB drive with sensitive work data. Can I be assured of its privacy?
column3: Yes, all found electronic devices are handled with confidentiality. They are not accessed by staff and are stored securely until claimed.

column2: If my lost luggage is found damaged, can I claim repair costs?
column3: You should file a damage report with your airline, not the Lost & Found. Airlines are responsible for baggage handling and have policies for repair or compensation.

column2: My child lost a retainer/braces case. Are such items kept?
column3: Yes, such personal medical items are logged and stored. Due to hygiene reasons, they are kept for a limited time, so please report it quickly.

column2: I lost my passport from a country whose embassy is not in Pakistan. What should I do?
column3: Report it to the airport police and Lost & Found. They will guide you on contacting your nearest consulate or a diplomatic mission that represents your country.

column2: Can I check the Lost & Found's daily log of found items?
column3: The internal log is not public for security reasons. However, you can describe your item, and the staff will check the log for you.

column2: I found a single shoe. Should I still turn it in?
column3: Yes, please turn in any item you find, no matter how small. People often lose single items and will be grateful for their return.

column2: What happens if I file a report but provide the wrong contact number?
column3: This can cause significant delays. If you realize your mistake, please call the helpline or email them immediately with your case number and correct contact details.

column2: I lost an item with great sentimental value but little monetary worth. Will it be taken seriously?
column3: Absolutely. The Lost & Found team understands the importance of sentimental items and gives every reported loss equal attention.

column2: Is the Lost & Found office accessible for people with disabilities?
column3: Yes, the office is located in the main hall and is accessible. Staff will also provide assistance to anyone who requires it.

column2: My luggage arrived, but the airline's priority tag is missing. Do I need to report this?
column3: No, you only need to report it if the bag itself or its contents are missing or damaged. The tag itself does not need to be reported.

column2: I lost a sealed envelope with documents. Will the staff open it to identify the owner?
column3: Staff will only open it if there are no external identifying marks and it's necessary for identification. This is done under supervision and is documented.

column2: Can I get an update on my case via SMS?
column3: Yes, if you provide your mobile number, you may receive an SMS notification once your item is found and logged in the system.

column2: Are items found on the aircraft handed to the Lost & Found immediately?
column3: Cleaning crews first collect the items, which are then handed over to the airline's ground staff. The airline then transfers them to the central Lost & Found office.

column2: I lost a souvenir I just bought. Will a receipt help prove ownership?
column3: Yes, a purchase receipt is an excellent form of proof of ownership, especially for new items. Please bring it with you when you claim the item.

column2: If my item is not found after 90 days, is there any final step I can take?
column3: After 90 days, the chances of recovery are very low as the item is processed for disposal or auction. The case is officially closed.

column2: I've recovered my item. How can I leave positive feedback for the staff?
column3: You can leave feedback at the airport's information desk or through the official feedback section on the Islamabad Airport website.
